author: Marleny Arnoldi
title: Lucapa recovers 203 ct diamond in Angola
text: Lucapa recovers 203 ct diamond in Angola Lucapa's latest recovered 203 ct diamond As a magazine-and-online subscriber to Creamer Media's Engineering News & Mining Weekly, you are entitled to one free research report of your choice. You would have received a promotional code at the time of your subscription. Have this code ready and click [here](https://store.creamermedia.co.za/products/). At the time of check-out, please enter your promotional code to download your free report. Email [subscriptions@creamermedia.co.za](mailto:subscriptions@creamermedia.co.za) if you have forgotten your promotional code. If you have previously accessed your free report, you can purchase additional Research Reports by clicking on the â€œBuy Reportâ€ button on this page. The most cost-effective way to access all our Research Reports is by subscribing to Creamer Media's Research Channel Africa - you can upgrade your subscription now at this [link](https://store.creamermedia.co.za/products/research-channel-africa-1-user-1). The most cost-effective way to access all our Research Reports is by subscribing to Creamer Media's Research Channel Africa - you can upgrade your subscription now at this [link](https://store.creamermedia.co.za/products/research-channel-africa-1-user-1). For a full list of Research Channel Africa benefits, click [here](https://cdn.creamermedia.com/e-magazines/engineering-news/ResearchChannalMay2023/index.html) If you are not a subscriber, you can either buy the individual research report by clicking on the â€˜Buy Reportâ€™ button, or you can subscribe and, not only gain access to your one free report, but also enjoy all other subscriber benefits, including 1) an electronic archive of back issues of the weekly news magazine; 2) access to an industrial and mining projects browser; 3) access to a database of published articles; and 4) the ability to save articles for future reference. At the time of your subscription, Creamer Mediaâ€™s subscriptions department will be in contact with you to ensure that you receive a copy of your preferred Research Report. The most cost-effective way to access all our Research Reports is by subscribing to Creamer Media's Research Channel Africa - you can upgrade your subscription now at this [link](https://store.creamermedia.co.za/products/research-channel-africa-1-user-1). If you are a Creamer Media subscriber, click [here](javascript:void(0);) to log in. ASX-listed Lucapa Diamond Company has recovered a 203 ct type IIa diamond at its 40%-owned Lulo Alluvial operations, in Angola. The diamond is the fifth-largest diamond to be recovered from Lulo since mining started in 2015. Its recovery follows two other diamonds recovered in February, weighing 162 ct and 116 ct, respectively. [click here](https://www.miningweekly.com/page/latest-videos) Comments Latest Multimedia sponsored by Press Office Announcements What's On Subscribe to improve your user experience... Option 1 (equivalent of R125 a month): Receive a weekly copy of Creamer Media's Engineering News & Mining Weekly magazine (print copy for those in South Africa and e-magazine for those outside of South Africa) Receive daily email newsletters Access to full search results Access archive of magazine back copies Access to Projects in Progress Access to ONE Research Report of your choice in PDF format Option 2 (equivalent of R375 a month): All benefits from Option 1 PLUS Access to Creamer Media's [Research Channel Africa](https://www.researchchannel.co.za) for ALL Research Reports, in PDF format, on various industrial and mining sectors including Electricity; Water; Energy Transition; Hydrogen; Roads, Rail and Ports; Coal; Gold; Platinum; Battery Metals; etc. Already a subscriber? Forgotten your password? MAGAZINE & ONLINE R1500 (equivalent of R125 a month) [SUBSCRIBE](https://store.creamermedia.co.za/products/copy-of-magazine-online-1-year-hard-copy-south-africa-only) Receive weekly copy of Creamer Media's Engineering News & Mining Weekly magazine (print copy for those in South Africa and e-magazine for those outside of South Africa) âž• Recieve daily email newsletters âž• Access to full search results âž• Access archive of magazine back copies âž• Access to Projects in Progress âž• Access to ONE Research Report of your choice in PDF format RESEARCH CHANNEL AFRICA R4500 (equivalent of R375 a month) [SUBSCRIBE](https://store.creamermedia.co.za/products/research-channel-africa-1-user-1) All benefits from Option 1 âž• Access to Creamer Media's [Research Channel Africa](https://www.researchchannel.co.za) for ALL Research Reports on various industrial and mining sectors, in PDF format, including on: Electricity âž• Water âž• Energy Transition âž• Hydrogen âž• Roads, Rail and Ports âž• Coal âž• Gold âž• Platinum âž• Battery Metals âž• etc. CORPORATE PACKAGES Discounted prices based on volume [CLICK FOR A QUOTATION](mailto:subscriptions@creamermedia.co.za?subject=Corporate Package Subscription Quotation needed) Receive all benefits from Option 1 or Option 2 delivered to numerous people at your company âž• Multiple User names and Passwords for simultaneous log-ins âž• Intranet integration access to all in your organisation

author: Mary Walrath-Holdridge
title: Kathleen Wilson's Minnesota dentist did 30 procedures at once: lawsuit
text: 20 fillings, 4 root canals, 8 crowns in one visit add up to lawsuit for Minnesota dentist [Mary Walrath-Holdridge](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/12093029002/mary-walrathholdridge/) A Minnesota dentist has become the subject of a malpractice lawsuit after his patient accused him of "disfiguring" her. The civil lawsuit was filed in Hennepin County, Minnesota last week by Kathleen Wilson, who alleged Dr. Kevin Molldrem and [Molldrem Family Dentistry](https://molldremdentistry.com/) caused her significant injury that is still being corrected. According to the suit, Molldrem performed more than 30 producers on Wilson in a single July 2020 visit, doing eight crowns, four root canals and 20 fillings in one go. The lawsuit alleges that the dentist "perform[ed] this work improperly," resulting in pain and suffering, embarrassment, emotional distress, and disfigurement. Molldrem was likewise accused of using improper levels of anesthesia during the procedures and falsifying medical records to cover it up. Treatment called 'inconceivable' â€œIt is inconceivable that Dr. Molldrem could have prepared and placed 8 crowns under these circumstances in the time allotted, not to mention the additional 20 restorations,â€ wrote [Dr. Avrum Goldstein,](https://www.seakexperts.com/members/4827-avrum-r-goldstein) a dentist and expert witness brought on by Wilson's attorney, in an affidavit. Goldstein, who is a faculty member at [NOVA Southeastern University](https://dental.nova.edu/aboutus/faculty/goldstein-avrum%20.html?_gl=1*1kqtqxq*_gcl_au*ODA4NzUxNTA1LjE3MDM3OTc5MjI.), also wrote that Wilson had been correctly diagnosed as having a "rare condition" causing decay in almost all of her teeth, but Mollderm's course of action was not a proper form of treatment. "[Wilsonâ€™s] required a slow, thoughtful, careful and measured response to her disease,â€ he said in his report. â€œTrying to fill every hole in every tooth in her mouth in one visit is not only the antithesis of what was indicated, it is not humanly possible to achieve in an effective or constructive manner.â€ Doctors remove wrong organ from man: [They opened him up to remove his appendix. They mistakenly took out much more, lawsuit says.](/story/news/health/2023/11/07/doctors-accidentally-remove-wrong-organ-surgery/71487292007/) The lawsuit also accused Mollderm of tampering with medical records to falsify the amount of anesthesia that was reportedly used, which in reality was nearly double the standard number of units, according to court paperwork. According to Goldstein, the maximum dose of anesthesia given in three hours should not exceed 490 mg, but Molldrem's records show he gave Wilson 960 mg. â€œAny negative cardiovascular or central nervous system outcomes could be tied to the local anesthetic overdose," he wrote. Wilson said in the suit that she has since had to have the dental work completely redone by other dentists to repair Molldremâ€™s â€œnegligent work," an ongoing process that has caused her to lose income and rack up medical bills on top of enduring pain, suffering and embarrassment. She is seeking more than $50,000 in damages. Wilson's attorney and Molldrem did not immediately respond to request for comment.

author: Anna LuÃ­sa
title: ExercÃ­cios curtos aumentam a ForÃ§a Muscular? Pesquisa surpreende!
text:
Pesquisadores da Universidade Edith Cowan, na AustrÃ¡lia, em colaboraÃ§Ã£o com a Universidade de SaÃºde e Bem-Estar Niigata, no JapÃ£o, realizaram um estudo inovador sobre os efeitos de exercÃ­cios de curta duraÃ§Ã£o na ForÃ§a Muscular. O foco do estudo foi entender como contraÃ§Ãµes breves, mas regulares, podem impactar a forÃ§a do bÃ­ceps. A pesquisa envolveu jovens voluntÃ¡rios saudÃ¡veis que realizaram contraÃ§Ãµes de trÃªs segundos do bÃ­ceps ao longo de quatro semanas.
Os resultados foram surpreendentes: aqueles que se exercitaram trÃªs vezes por semana apresentaram um aumento significativo na ForÃ§a Muscular. Em contraste, os participantes que realizaram o exercÃ­cio apenas duas vezes por semana nÃ£o mostraram mudanÃ§as notÃ¡veis. Essa descoberta sugere que a frequÃªncia dos exercÃ­cios pode ser mais importante do que a duraÃ§Ã£o em si.
Como trÃªs segundos de exercÃ­cio podem fazer diferenÃ§a?
A pesquisa revelou que, em mÃ©dia, houve um aumento de 2,5% na capacidade de levantamento de peso e 3,9% na forÃ§a ao abaixar o peso. O professor Kazunori Nosaka, lÃ­der do estudo, destacou que exercÃ­cios curtos e regulares sÃ£o mais eficazes do que sessÃµes longas e esporÃ¡dicas. Segundo Nosaka, as adaptaÃ§Ãµes musculares ocorrem principalmente durante o perÃ­odo de descanso, tornando os intervalos entre os exercÃ­cios cruciais para o desenvolvimento da forÃ§a e da massa muscular.
O estudo enfatiza que, embora o exercÃ­cio em si dure apenas trÃªs segundos, o tempo de descanso entre as sessÃµes Ã© essencial. Nosaka menciona que o descanso no estudo foi cerca de 28.800 vezes maior que o tempo de exercÃ­cio, sublinhando a importÃ¢ncia do repouso na recuperaÃ§Ã£o e fortalecimento muscular.
Qual Ã© o impacto dos exercÃ­cios curtos na vida diÃ¡ria?
Para muitas pessoas, encontrar tempo para exercÃ­cios longos e intensos pode ser um desafio. No entanto, este estudo sugere que mesmo exercÃ­cios breves, quando realizados regularmente, podem trazer benefÃ­cios significativos. Nosaka aponta que, para algumas pessoas, dedicar 20 minutos diÃ¡rios ao exercÃ­cio pode ser inviÃ¡vel, mas apenas cinco minutos podem fazer uma diferenÃ§a perceptÃ­vel na saÃºde muscular.
Embora os resultados sejam promissores, Nosaka ressalta a necessidade de mais pesquisas para validar completamente suas descobertas. Ele destaca a importÃ¢ncia de entender que mesmo pequenas quantidades de exercÃ­cio, se realizadas consistentemente, podem impactar positivamente o corpo humano.
Quais sÃ£o as implicaÃ§Ãµes futuras para a prÃ¡tica de exercÃ­cios?
As descobertas deste estudo podem revolucionar a forma como as pessoas abordam o exercÃ­cio fÃ­sico. Com a crescente demanda por soluÃ§Ãµes de saÃºde eficientes e de fÃ¡cil implementaÃ§Ã£o, a ideia de que breves perÃ­odos de exercÃ­cio podem ser tÃ£o eficazes quanto sessÃµes mais longas Ã© atraente. Isso pode incentivar mais pessoas a incorporar exercÃ­cios em suas rotinas diÃ¡rias, mesmo com agendas apertadas.
AlÃ©m disso, a pesquisa abre caminho para novos estudos sobre a otimizaÃ§Ã£o de exercÃ­cios para diferentes grupos populacionais, incluindo idosos e pessoas com mobilidade reduzida. A possibilidade de melhorar a saÃºde muscular com um investimento mÃ­nimo de tempo pode ter um impacto significativo na saÃºde pÃºblica.
Em suma, a pesquisa conduzida pelas universidades Edith Cowan e Niigata oferece uma nova perspectiva sobre a prÃ¡tica de exercÃ­cios, destacando a importÃ¢ncia da regularidade e do descanso na construÃ§Ã£o da ForÃ§a Muscular. Ã€ medida que mais estudos sÃ£o realizados, a compreensÃ£o sobre os benefÃ­cios dos exercÃ­cios de curta duraÃ§Ã£o continuarÃ¡ a evoluir, potencialmente transformando prÃ¡ticas de saÃºde e bem-estar em todo o mundo.

author: Steve Frothingham
title: More Americans Rode a Bike Than Ever Before in 2024, Youth Participation Saw the Biggest Surge
text:
PeopleForBikes released its 2024 U.S. Bicycling Participation Study, offering new insights into bicycling trends across the country. This biennial report reveals that 112 million Americans â€” 35% of those ages 3 and older â€” rode a bike at least once in 2024. This marks the highest participation rate since the study began in 2014, underscoring an increasing interest in bicycling propelled by the COVID-19 pandemic.
In even better news, youth participation (ages 3 to 17) in bicycling increased from 49% to 56% since the last study, reversing a steady decline in youth ridership since 2018. As the bike industry continues to navigate sales turbulence and economic headwinds, this data provides key information to guide industry investments, advocacy efforts, and infrastructure development.
â€œThe significant increase in youth participation signals a potential new generation of lifelong riders, but with 53% of riders worried about being hit by a car, we must take action to ensure people today and tomorrow feel safe and comfortable riding a bike,â€ said Jenn Dice, president and CEO of PeopleForBikes. â€œThis underscores the urgent need for continued investment in safe places to ride and highlights the critical importance of connecting bicycle networks both on and off-road to ensure safer, more accessible riding experiences for all.â€
Other notable findings from the PeopleForBikes study:
-
50% of riders said they are familiar with the bike lanes, paths, and trails in their area.
-
Ridership increased by 9% for youth ages 3 to 9 and 15% for youth ages 10 to 17.
-
Traveling to/from social or recreation activities became the number one reason for transportation riding, bumping errands/shopping.
In addition to these insights, the report provides detailed breakdowns of how frequently Americans are riding, regional participation trends, and indoor-versus-outdoor riding, among other findings. It also examines consumer motivations and behaviors behind why they ride, how they feel when they ride, and even examines how likely non-riders are to get on a bicycle in the future.
As with past reports, the 2024 data was generated through survey results from 16,000 adults nationwide. The study used the same methodology as previous participation studies, allowing PeopleForBikes to tap into 10 years of historical data to track how bicycling participation and perceptions have evolved over time.
The full report can be accessed for free by PeopleForBikes Coalition members in the PeopleForBikes Member Center. The study is available for purchase by non-members in the PeopleForBikes Resource Marketplace.
About PeopleForBikes
PeopleForBikes is a national bike foundation and the U.S. bicycle industryâ€™s trade association representing more than 340 bicycle industry supplier members and nearly 1.4 million individuals. Through our three areas of influence â€” infrastructure, policy, and participation â€” we accelerate the construction of safe, fun, and connected places to bike; advance pro-bike and pro-bike-business legislation; and welcome more people to the joys of riding a bike. Our goal: Become the best place to ride a bike in the world. Join us at PeopleForBikes.org.

author: @mathrubhumi
title: 14 injured after bus collides with lorry in Thrissur's Pannithadam
text:
The incident occurred at 01.30 am on the Akkikavu bypass, bus driver critically injured
Thrissur: Fourteen people were injured when a KSRTC bus and a lorry carrying fish collided in Pannithadam junction on the Akkikavu bypass in Thrissur on Thursday morning. The bus driverâ€™s injuries are critical, according to media reports.
The accident occurred in the wee hours of the day, at 01.30 am. The KSRTC bus was travelling from Calicut to Kumily, Idukki, when the collision occurred. The lorry had loaded fish from Kunnamkulam and was headed to Alathur.
Following the accident, the two vehicles rammed into a nearby shop. The front side of both vehicles were completely destroyed in the process. The injured have been admitted to a private hospital in Kunnamkulam.
Accidents have become a regular occurrence after the bypass was renovated. A similar incident took place recently when a fish lorry collided with another lorry. Temporary arrangements have been erected on the bypass to enable motorists to control speed while driving and prevent accidents. However, lack of such safety measures on the Wadakkanchery-Chavakkad State Highway poses problems at present.

author: Gaius Bolling
title: Michael Keaton Has Harsh Words for Donald Trump & Elon Musk
text: Batman has spoken! Michael Keaton is no stranger to speaking his mind, something he usually does in a stern, yet intelligent, way. With the Presidential election almost upon us, Keaton has a message to male voters about Republican nominee Donald Trump and Elon Musk, an unlikely pair united in their goal to put the convicted former president in the White House again. Despite some males seemingly believing that the duo respects them, their well-being, and their opinions, Keaton wants to make it clear that this is not the case. Keaton took to his Instagram page to post a video where he declared that both Trump and Musk "don't really respect you," speaking specifically to male voters who are still considering voting for Trump. The actor was pretty pointed in his comments but spoke some serious truths about the pair if you fall on Keaton's side. The actor continued: "Some of you folks, guys mostly, who are thinking about attending a rally with Musk and Trump â€” they donâ€™t really respect you. They laugh at you behind your back. They think youâ€™re stupid. They donâ€™t want to hang out with you. They have nothing in common with you. Theyâ€™re not your bros.â€ Keaton is speaking on how Trump particularly wants to sell that he's for the people and will be in support of all Americans should he be elected president again. The actor has thrown his support behind Vice President Kamala Harris for her Presidential bid, even campaigning for Harris in his native Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, which will be a key swing state in determining the election. It's clear that Keaton believes Trump and his supporters will say whatever they need to say to get elected but, in the long run, they couldn't care less about the little man and only care about themselves. The Batman actor also believes Trump is aware of his pull with his supporters, pointing to the former President saying he could shoot someone on Fifth Avenue and his supporters would still vote for him. Keaton elaborated on that by saying, "Basically, what heâ€™s saying in parentheses is people are so stupid. Theyâ€™re so dumb, theyâ€™d still vote for me. They have no respect for you, trust me." Michael Keaton Isn't the Only Actor to Call Out Donald Trump Keaton isn't the only person who has called out Trump and the male voters who believe he's a "bro" or some alpha male. Dave Bautista recently appeared on Jimmy Kimmel Live! in a taped segment that called out this very notion , insinuating that Trump isn't a man at all and that his male supporters need to be aware of that. Bautista is an actor that has also put his support behind Harris and hasn't been shy about letting that be known. [Related ](/donald-trump-bashes-the-apprentice/) [ Donald Trump Finally Breaks His Silence About The Apprentice ](/donald-trump-bashes-the-apprentice/) The convicted former President unsurprisingly bashes the controversial biopic. Sebastian Stan, who plays Trump in the latest film The Apprentice, has called out the former President for different reasons, particularly his hypocrisy . Stan was asked if the film would serve a purpose in swaying voters away from Trump, and he asked voters to "dig deeper" before they think about whomever they may vote for. The actor said, "I don't know. But what I do hope is that people regardless of their opinion, are curious enough to try to dig deeper. Because I think we're living in a world where it's so easy to be handed an opinion everywhere you turn." He then went on to voice his opinion on Trump trying to censor his movie. "He's been trying to censor this movie, and at the same time, he claims that he acknowledges free speech...I can't think of anything more hypocritical. So at the end of the day, it's about him as a character. Forget the politics and just go in there and use your instinct and ask yourself: Do you trust this man?"
